page.title: 03DEVIZES,A GARRISON TOWN.
page.content: Devizes became a Garrison Town in 1873 and 5 years later,the Wiltshire Regiment adopted the Town as its base. The Regimental Museum was formed into a trust in 1963 and its collection stored at Le Marchant Barracks. It includes items from many Army units and also the two V.C's won by the Regiment. The Army has forged many happy links with the townspeople of Devizes,and until 1959,St James' served as the Garrison Church.The old hutted army camps were formed into two barracks named after Hopton and Prince Maurice, although the former is now a trading estate. The Royal Army Ordnance Corps were the last regiment to serve in Devizes and they left in 1983,but the town still retains its military links having a T.A.Unit and a Cadet Force.
